item.title: Flexible Biquality Learning with Mutual Information
item.guid: Flexible Biquality Learning with Mutual Information
item.description: The concept of Biquality Data has been introduced in "Unifying Semi-Supervised and Robust Learning by Mixup" by Hataya and Nakayama where there is two sets of data, a trusted and an untrusted one.

item.title: Importance Reweighting for Positive Unlabeled Learning
item.guid: Importance Reweighting for Positive Unlabeled Learning
item.description: After redoing the proofs of "Classification with Noisy Labels by Importance Reweighting" by Liu and Tao, we thought that extending their results to Positive Unlabeled Learning could be quite trivial and useful.

item.title: Some proofs about Statistical Learning and Label Noise
item.guid: Some proofs about Statistical Learning and Label Noise
item.description: When doing binary classfication, having noise in our label means that they can be flipped from one class to the other. When observing a label, we will never know if it has been flipped or not, only the probability of the flip to occur.
